headline: The Score: Netflix, Amazon.com, Six Flags and More Stocks That Defined the Week
summary: Investors tuned out on  Netflix  after the streaming giant’s quarterly earnings came in below expectations.  Netflix on Tuesday reported higher quarterly profit and sales, driven by membership growth, price hikes and increased advertising revenue.  On the earnings miss, the media giant cited an expense related to a dispute with Brazilian tax authorities.

headline: Netflix Produces Strong FCF Q3 Margins - NFLX Looks 23% Too Cheap
summary: Netflix produced a 23% Q3 FCF margin, in line with its YTD margin. NFLX stock has fallen since the release, putting its value over 23% higher at $1374 per share. This value is based on a 2.0% FCF yield, more conservative than before.

headline: Is the market due for a correction despite strong earnings?
summary: US stocks (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) inch higher Thursday morning as major companies continue to report earnings, the latest being EV developer Tesla (TSLA), IBM (IBM), toymaker Hasbro (HAS), and streaming giant Netflix (NFLX). Great Hill Capital Chairman and Managing Member Thomas Hayes expands upon what he is seeing in the earnings landscape as the rest of the Magnificent Seven prepare to report quarterly results and whether equities could be due for a correction ahead of a year-end rally. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Netflix: Fundamentals Remain Intact, But Valuation Is Still A Concern
summary: Netflix delivered mixed 3Q results, missing EPS due to a one-time Brazilian tax, but provided slightly better-than-expected 4Q guidance. See why NFLX stock is a Hold.

headline: Roku (ROKU): Examining Valuation as Netflix's Results Rattle Streaming Stocks
summary: Roku (ROKU) shares dipped 3% as the streaming sector responded to Netflix’s disappointing third-quarter profit and softer revenue guidance. Investor sentiment across streaming stocks often shifts quickly when a major peer reports weaker results. See our latest analysis for Roku. Roku’s share price has been steadily climbing in 2025, with a 31.9% share price return year-to-date and a 32.7% total return over the past 12 months. This performance comes despite occasional volatility and a recent...
